metadata.Title: CVE-2022-25235 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high.
metadata.Description:
xmltok_impl.c in Expat (aka libexpat) before 2.4.5 lacks certain validation of encoding, such as checks for whether a UTF-8 character is valid in a certain context.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25235` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

expat - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2
libexpat1 - 2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

notes.Note: sbeattie> paraview uses system expat xotcl uses system expat poco uses system expat gdcm uses system expat audacity uses system expat simgear uses system expat coin3 uses system expat as of 4.0.0~CMake~6f54f1602475+ds1-1 sitecopy uses system expat since 1:0.16.0-1 (dapper!)

criterions.comment: cadaver package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
expat package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.9-1ubuntu0.2').
firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
libxmltok package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
matanza package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
swish-e package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
tdom package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'bundled deps handled by upstream in new versions').
wbxml2 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
xmlrpc-c package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
